p: Our study objects are 16 tropical plant species identified to be frequently used by Ugandan traditional healers in treatment of diverse medical disorders in the Greater Mpigi region. This choice of species can be considered taxonomically diverse, representing 13 different plant families. Table 1 lists these species, stating their scientific names, local names at the study site (Luganda language), their plant families, and their Relative Frequencies of Citation (RFC), calculated from absolute values of the ethnobotanical survey ( n = 39) previously published by Schultz et al. [ 14].
